hero.title: Technology Watch:
hero.subtitle: The future of cybersecurity facing the quantum revolution

intro.label: Introduction & Context
intro.title: Introduction & Context
intro.problem: How do quantum computers threaten current encryption systems, and what solutions are emerging to secure our digital infrastructure?
intro.context1: Current encryption algorithms (RSA, ECC) protect our communications, banking transactions, and personal data
intro.context2: The arrival of quantum computers renders these protections potentially obsolete
intro.context3: NIST standardized new algorithms in 2024 to prepare for this transition

threat.label: The Quantum Threat
threat.title: The Quantum Threat
threat.quantumDesc: Unlike classical computers that use bits (0 or 1), quantum computers leverage qubits capable of being in multiple states simultaneously (superposition). This property gives them exponentially superior computing power for certain mathematical problems.
threat.shorTitle: Shor's Algorithm: The end of RSA
threat.shor1: Ability to factor large numbers in polynomial time
threat.shor2: RSA-2048 could be broken in hours by a sufficiently powerful quantum computer
threat.shor3: "Harvest now, decrypt later": data encrypted today can be stored to be decrypted later

solutions.label: Post-Quantum Solutions
solutions.title: Post-Quantum Solutions
solutions.subtitle: NIST 2024 Standards - New algorithms resistant to quantum attacks
solutions.kyberDesc: Based on lattice problems, CRYSTALS-Kyber replaces RSA/ECC for secure key exchange.
solutions.kyber1: Based on the MLWE (Module Learning With Errors) problem
solutions.kyber3: Already adopted by Signal, Chrome, Cloudflare
solutions.dilithiumDesc: Alternative to RSA/ECDSA signatures, used for authentication and data integrity verification.
